result.execSummary:
The defendant James J Taracek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to current sentence defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-No weapons.
-No contact with victim.
-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-No association with drug dealers. 
-Maintain full time employment however defendant may not take cash jobs, contract or sub contractor jobs.
-No pawning/scraping of items.
-Defendant may not possess financial information of others.
-Pay supervision fees.

**Restitution hearing scheduled for 6/10/2015 at 11:00 am. Defendant to appear by video conference for the restitution hearing.

Court held restitution hearing on 6/10/2015 and determined restitution amount to be $5200. Bond of $500 applied to restitution amount, balance of fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant James J Taracek in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2. Court examines defendant and finds him guilty. Counsel request a presentence report. At sentencing, State will recommend prison of 4 years-1 yr initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision consecutive to any revocation sentence, restitution. Court orders a presentenve investigation be completed and adjourns sentencing to 5/21/2015 at 3:00 pm. Court orders bail revoked.
